Articles.Content:
Very recently a commercial game was released titled 'Army Rage' ([www.armyrage.com](http://www.armyrage.com))

The game\'s developers have **stolen** tons of assets such as models + textures of weapons and tanks. Also several gun sounds from Forgotten Hope 1 mod for Bf1942, Forgotten Hope 2 mod for Battlefield 2, things from the original Battlefield 1942 and Day of Defeat: Source.

This is copyright infringement. 

**Do not support these developers. Do not play their game.**

You can read more here: [http://forgottenhope.warumdarum.de/armyrage/](http://forgottenhope.warumdarum.de/armyrage/)

Looks convincing.

Some I would have to digsagree with, there is only a finite number of ways you can model a certain car for example.

Still, many of the textures do appear to have simply been jigged around.

On the whole I think (from the evidence I was given) 'Army Rage' appears to be a total rip-off. Even the name sucks. I shall support the cause!

Some of it looksy iffy, as in maybe they didn\'t copy it

e.g. the sandbags

But the 3D image layouts (the tanks specifically) are pretty damning. Highly unlikely for 2 separate games and companies to create 3d layouts in the same exact manner and with the images being so very, very similar.

'Army Rage was developed by 'Tuyasoft', based in Beijing, China'

Found the problem! China!
I\'d say the most convincing thing is the texture that still had the signature on it that was found in the army rage game files. There is no way that could ever happen.

Here is another thing.

![B8L1M.png](http://i.imgur.com/B8L1M.png)

This is the Forgotten Hope 2 LMG.

![i8BA8.png](http://i.imgur.com/i8BA8.png)

That is the Army Rage one.

They are EXACTLY the same other than they took the handle off and gave it a shiny texture.
If anything, they look slightly higher in polygon count.

As I said before, there are only a finite number of ways you can model certain things.

The textures are most damning.
I\'ll just say this. The fact that the UVW maps are identical matches in the tank textures.... yea... they stole that content.

could someone just tell the modders that some rip off game has stolen their intellectual

property and they could face legal action what about someone tell the guys who made the game

and it would sort them out ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) >![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
I would like to say I mean sort them out legally not phisically
Well, i dont play FPS so,
They stole the textures and made them look crappy. Should get an idiotism award for that.

Perhaps someone should get the Better Business Bureau involved, unless this is outside of what their interdiction.
One thing, if they already can\'t really create models, why should they be able to write the code for this themselves?

It\'s entirely possible that they can make code, but not models.

Look at FreeSpace 2\'s Inferno Upgrade. They can churn out models like nobody\'s business but they can\'t be arsed to map half of them because they have very few UV artists / texturers.
